title: Blox Fruits: How to Get the Angel Race + Angel Race Stats & Buffs

steps.title: Start the game as one.
steps.content: Start the game as one. Angel is one of the four races you can start Blox Fruits with, and you have a 12.5% chance of spawning into the game as an Angel. The other races you can start as are Human (62.5% spawn rate), Rabbit (12.5% spawn rate), and Shark (12.5% spawn rate). [1] X Research source

steps.title: Use a Race Reroll.
steps.content: Use a Race Reroll. Race Rerolls will change your race to one of the other starting races at random. There is a 33% chance to change into an Angel if you use a Race Reroll (that chance is lowered to 25% if you're a Ghoul or Cyborg). You can get Race Rerolls the following ways: Buy one from the Shop for 90 Robux Buy from Tort for 3,000 Fragments Buy from the Event Shop or Death King during certain events

steps.title: V1
steps.content: V1 This is the starting stage for Angels. Buffs: Slightly increased jump height. Visual changes: Small white wings.

steps.title: V2
steps.content: V2 Unlocked by doing the Alchemist's Quest. To complete this quest, you must complete the Colosseum Quest. [2] X Research source Buffs: Increased Air Jump height, Air Jumping takes 20% less energy, and one additional Air Jump is gained. Visual changes: None.

steps.title: V3
steps.content: V3 Unlocked by completing arowe's Quest, which involves killing another player who is the Angel race. Buffs: Heavenly Blood is unlocked. When activated it lasts for 6.5 seconds and has a cooldown of 20 seconds. Heavenly Blood does the following: Defense is increased by 15% The player is healed for 20% of their maximum health and 10% of their maximum energy The player gets natural regeneration Visual changes: The player's wings are bigger and they flap.

steps.title: V4 (awakened)
steps.content: V4 (awakened) Unlocked by completing the Temple of Time puzzle followed by the Trial of the King. Buffs: Stats, damage, speed, and healing are increased when transformed. Unlock Prince of the Skies and King's Rule. Prince of the Skies allows the user to free fly and glide. King's Rule gives the player an aura that causes nearby enemies to be slowed, take damage, and have their energy drained. They will also see a screen distortion effect. Visual changes: Wings are even bigger. When transformed, the player gets a second pair of wings and a halo.
